inn1.comm: short of a length, angling in towards off, fended off the back foot
seams back in from short of a length, hits Smith high, on the thigh pad. Half an appeal from Junaid
some more movement for Junaid but he started well outside off, and is left alone
angling in, goes off the inside half of the bat, gets him a couple to long leg
a bit too short, a bit too wide, cut away to third man for one
short of a length, on off, angles away, left alone
wide length ball, left alone
shuffles across to a shortish delivery outside off, defends it in front of his chest
short of a length, on off, seams away to beat the shuffling Smith
lovely bowling. He is getting seam movement from just short of a length and in front of middle, making him play, then beating him
looks to work this to leg, but is hit on the thigh pad in front of off
another heavy ball, 141ks, just outside off, short of a length, and Smith rises with it in defence
on a length, on off, pushed back to him
full, almost a half-volley, driven nicely, but, straight to mid-off
Amla looks to punch this shortish delivery to leg, is beaten but is hit high on the thigh

this is fuller, and hence a louder appeal as it seems to be lower, but it is clearly pitched outside leg. Junaid wanted to review this, and would have ended up wasting it had he succeeded in convincing Misbah
length ball, middle and leg, angling towards off, defended
driven on the up, through the covers, along the ground. Amla has smashed this one
short of a length, middle and leg, Smith is on his toes in defence
Smith is beaten on the flick again, and is hit high on the thigh again
backs away to make room this time, Gul cleverly slips this one wide outside off. Smith can't reach it
Smith looks to pull this short ball from outside off, but this seams away to be called a wide
left alone outside off this time
that's quick too. Short of a length, 142ks, skids away to beat Smith's cut
lovely ball to end the over. Seaming away from short of a length and in front of low, it beats the defensive bat
lovely punch from Amla, Hafeez misfields at point, allows two runs
short of a length, middle and off, defended off the back foot
fuller, middle and off again, defended off the back foot
too short, too straight, and Amla goes back pull this over midwicket
Amla pushes at one away from the body, gets an inside edge that nearly gets him bowled. But they get a single in the end
short of a length, angling in towards off, Smith stays back, gets a soft leading edge as he defends
Gul continues to extract seam and bounce. Short of a length, just outside off, Amla punches at it, but is beaten by the away movement
this one seams the other way, at 146ks, gets a thick inside edge from Amla as he looks to punch this again. Painfully for Gul, it goes for four to fine leg
superb delivery again. Amla walks across and down the pitch, but it seams away from short of a length and beats the edge
this is fuller, towards off, and is defended off the back foot
and he has beaten the edge again. Gul has been bowling superbly but without any reward. Short of a length, just outside off, Amla plays at it, and is beaten by the away movement
well done by Younis Khan at second slip. This time Gul finally draws the edge, but it seems to be going wide of the second slip. But for that dive to his right by YK
typical Smith. He walks down and across, takes this on the half-volley, and clips it through midwicket for four
length all outside off, defended with an open face
short of a length, outside off, gets it to rise towards the chest. Defended
nice shot. Backs away to make room and lofts this length ball straight back over the bowler's head
short of a length, outside off, extra bounce, some movement, beats the outside edge
walks down the wicket, clips a length ball through leg for one
short of a length, just outside off, left alone
looks to pull, is a bit slow on this, gets a couple to the right of long leg
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, angling away, he looks to steer it, but finds the second slip
walks across to get close to this shortish wide delivery, and pulls it through midwicket for four
fuller, on off, defended off the back foot
drops a half chance. Okay let's make it a quarter chance. Amla throws his arms at a widish delivery, flies wide of point, Hafeez dives, gets both hands to it, but can't control it
Smith backs away, Junaid keeps this outside enough, and Smith's flay cant' reach it
Smith walks across to work this away from off. To deep square leg
walks down the wicket and pulls this short ball for a couple. Gul's throw from fine leg isn't that great, nor is AKmal's collection, and SA take an overthrow
once again Smith has given himself too room by backing away, and is beaten
short of a length, punched away between point and cover-point, but not far enough to beat the diving Malik
short of a length, middle and leg, bunted to leg for one
and immediately he draws an edge with one that holds its line outside off. This is played with soft hands, and wide of the only slip
nicely punched away between point and cover-point for two
fuller, on off, pushed slightly wide of cover, and they steal a single
Smith looks to drive a length ball in front of off, gets a thick inside edge for a single
steered away to third man for one
shortish, into the pads, worked away for one
Smith stays back to work this to leg, but Hafeez gets enough turn to get a leading edge

welcome back Karman Akmal. It's like you never left. Smith swishes, is beaten, Akmal fails to collect it cleanly. It's acceptable until then, but the ball has hardly gone five yards, and he is not awake to the bye being stolen
down the track to work this to leg for a single
worked off the pads for another single
opens the face on this, but can't beat point
sharp turn first up. From off, against the angle, beats the edge
Smith is jumping around a bit. He makes room, but is in con control of this drive. The edge somehow eludes the cover ring and goes for four
full, angling in, cramps him for room
Smith moves across the stumps to take this full ball and play it to leg for one
Amla gives him the charge, is beaten in the flight, get a thick inside edge. That's his third boundary off an edge
short of a length, outside off, turns in a lot, cramps his punch. Nearly played on
stays low even as Smith backs away to make room. The ball stays low, and is kept well by Akmal
walks down the wicket, works this to leg, takes a single
length ball, turning in, picked away for a single to deep square leg
Smith backs away to slog. Mis-hits this to deep midwicket for one
Amla back away this time, punches a flat delivery from outside off, between cover and cover-point
short of a length, turning in, concedes a leg-bye to short fine leg
flat, just outside off, defended off the back foot
down the wicket, beaten in the fight, gets an inside edge onto the pad, but it doesn't carry to cover-point
looks to make room, plays this offbreak to cover
stays a bit low, worked off the pads for one

Smith has reverse-paddled to his demise. He is looking to play the orthodox paddle, but reverse the bat face at the last moment. Extra bounce from Ajmal hits the glove, then the shoulder, and then lobs up for an easy catch
full, on the pads, swept away for a single
full, on the pads, clipped wide of deep midwicket for a couple
short of a length, worked away for a single to deep square leg
fired down the leg side
worked away off the hip
punched down the ground for a single
worked away off the pads for another single
quick, just outside off, pushed to cover
punched to deep cover for one
run-out chance. Pushed to cover-point, Amla wants the single, AB doesn't. This should ideally be Amla's call, but AB has made the right call to send him back. He is back in time, though
uppishly driven towards long-off for one
some turn from short of a length, in front of off, defended with an open face, gets a single
fuller, middle and off, defended to cover
fired down the leg side

Hafeez strikes as Amla's good luck finally runs out. His has been a charmed stay at the wicket. One low-percentage shot too many as he sweeps a fullish ball from in front of off. Gets a healthy top edge that settles with deep square leg
another ill-advised sweep. A paddle from AB, but he has get well outside the line
stays back to work this to deep midwicket
defended in front of off
follows a widish offbreak, is beaten
flatter, angling in, defended from the crease
driven to sweeper-cover for one
full, on the pads, worked away to deep midwicket
quick legbreak, 94ks, defended to short midwicket
full, on off, played back to him
slower through the air, 87ks, punched to deep point
tossed up high, full outside off, squeezed between point and short third
short of a length, punched wide of cover-point for one
big wide down the leg side
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, but gets a single as he works this to leg
flatter, fuller, Ingram stays back, is almost beaten, but leading edge falls safe
swept in the air, but this is no top edge. He has placed this between square leg and deep midwicket
full, on off, driven to long-on
short of a length, worked to short midwicket
gets a single to deep midwicket
short of a length, punched to deep cover for one
short of a length, straight, no turn, worked away for one
slightly short, cut away to deep point
tossed up outside off, pushed to the straightish short cover
pitched outside leg, holds its line, called a wide
flicked to square leg
punched down to long-on for one
slightly short, cut away, can't beat point
fuller, flat, pushed to cover-point
worked away off the pads, fine of fine leg for a couple
cut away to sweeper-cover for one
driven to long-on
tossed up on off, driven to deep cover for one
nicely swept. Powerfully done, from outside off, past square leg. In the air, but is hit well enough and wide enough of square leg
flatter, angles away, beats the outside edge
swept again as Afridi gives this some air. Fine of fine leg again
flat, short, back-cuts it. Deep point tidies up, but they steal the third on Umar Akmal's throw
dabbed away from just outside off for a single
tossed up outside off, driven to long-on for one
short of a length, punched down to long-off
whipped away to deep midwkcet. A fumble by Malik facilitates the second
worked away off the pads  for a single
fullish, just holds its line outside off, defended with an open face
pushed wide of point for a single
full, outside off, driven to long-on for one
flat, into the pads, beats his attempt at playing this to leg
swept away, wide of deep square, a diving save from Ajmal keeps the ball in play
tossed up, on off, pushed wide of cover for a single
flighted outside off, driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, worked away off the pads
length ball, turning into the pads, worked away to deep midwicket
short of a length, on off, punched to cover
can't beat cover with this punch either
makes room plays this in front of leg, but still keeps finding that man at cover
and again Ingram looks to make room, plays with an open face, but this time he plays it straight to point
too short this time, cut in front of square for a single
slow through the air, turns away from just outside off, beats the bat
flighted high, 83ks, middle and leg, turns towards middle, defended back to him
short of a length, pushed wide of point for one
short of a length, outside off, and he has reverse-swept this square, wide of deep cover, gets three runs
length ball, on off, defended to cover-point
full, paddled to short fine leg for one
length ball, middle and leg, defended back to him
down the wicket to work this into the leg side for a single
down the wicket, not close to the pitch of the ball, plays this defensively to short midwicket
AB charges again, finds the ball is short again, and plays this back to Hafeez
fuller, he stays in the crease, and drives it to long-on
driven to long-off for one
full, on off, driven to long-off
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
slower through the air, 84ks, defended off the front foot
looks to sweep this to leg, gets a top edge but it lands safe just behind the leg umpire
worked away off the pads for a single
slightly short, and he is cut away for a single
short of a length, middle and leg, turning towards off, played with an open face for a single
fullish, middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket
punched to long-off for one
turning down the leg side, called wide
fullish, worked to short midwicket
punched down to long-on for one
driven to long-off for one
tossed up on off, defended wide of cover for one
full, middle and leg, flicked wide of deep midwicket
punched away between deep midwicket and deep square leg again
some dip for him, turns in after pitching, beats the bat, but can't be lbw because this is headed down the leg side
nice shot. de Villiers charges down, is not to the pitch of the ball, but chips this into the gap between deep midwicket and deep square leg. AB's first boundary
pushed wide of long-on for two
slow, very slow, 75ks, Ingram waits and waits, is beaten by the offbreak. "I am a slow bowler," says Ajmal
this is quicker, flatter, straighter, and he has swept this superbly through long leg
short of a length, turning away from off, gets an inside edge on the punch
short, wide, crashed away between point and short third. Ingram has played well here, making spinners pitch it short through his sweeps
punched away to deep point for one
length-ball offbreak, clipped away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, middle and leg, worked away to long leg for one
short of a length, on off, pushed straight to point. AB is half way down the pitch before he realises there is no single available, but makes it back in time
full, beats the flick, but this is handed down the leg side. Can;t understand Junaid's long persistent appeal
short of a length, rises with it, runs it down to third man for the single that brings up his fifty
short of a length, middle and leg, defended to cover
dabbed away to third man for one
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, gets his pad behind the offbreak
short of a length, goes back to work it to deep square leg
short of a length, on off, worked away to deep midwicket
top shot. He just made up his mind this ball has to over extra cover never mind the lenght and line. Goes back, makes room, and lofts this shortish delivery over extra cover. That's his fifty too
he is waiting for the long hop that usually results after a boundary down the ground. And long hop it is. Pulls it behind square for four
flatter, wide down the leg side
swept away to deep square leg for one
short of a length, middle and off, worked to leg for one
driven between mid-off and cover
short of a length, worked into the leg side for one
length ball, pretty straight, AB defends this back to him
short, pretty gently, smoked away to deep midwicket
widish length ball. Ingram drives without feet. Is beaten
flat offbreak, beats his attempt to flick it
punched down to long-on for one
punched down to deep cover for one
makes a bit of room, but can't push it past short cover
down the wicket to drive this to long-on
slower through the air, cut to point, Ingram is slow in taking off but beats Gul's throw
down the wicket, takes this on the full, gets a single to deep midwicket
pushed to short cover
back-foot drive that almost goes for a six. This is some shot. Short of a length, widish, he goes back and chips it over extra cover. Lands just before the rope
swept away for a single
flighted on off, driven back to Afridi
a little too cute as he looks to run this fine behind square on the off side, but after he has shown him the sweep

AB falls. Relief for Pakistan. Almal has gone round the stumps, and pitched short of a length. AB makes room, looks to go over extra cover again, but hasn't got enough and hence no elevation. Caught at short cover
sharp offbreak, beats the inside edge, draws an lbw appeal, but it has hit him outside the line of off
arm ball, punched to short cover
driven to deep point for one
tossed up, on middle and off, du Plessis has moved to far across, is beaten, but is probably headed down leg
down the wicket to defend this to leg

Afridi reviews this. He has not even waited to consult with the captain. That looked really really close to me. Tossed up, slow through the air, beat Ingram's sweep, and hit him low on the pad. No edge on it. So let's see where it pitched and where it was headed. It is taking them an age to process this. Just get on with it. They are still debating whether there is an edge on it. A thousand replays with Hot Spot, and we are still not convinced. Just move on, people. They are looking for a touch on the top strap of the glove. A front-on replay doesn't quite show that touch, but there is a slight Hot Spot on that glove strap as the ball passes. So they don't even look at where the ball pitched and where it was headed because he is deemed to have played this
flat, on the pads, concedes three leg-byes
length ball, legbreak, hits the outside half of the bat
full toss, pushed wide of straight midwicket for one
short, looks like an offbreak, pushed to cover
flighted on off, pushed to mid-off for one
short, outside off, cut away for a single
short of a length, outside off, misses out on a flick to leg
tossed up wide outside off, beats his sweep
flatter offbreak, beats the inside edge, appeals for lbw, but he has hit him outside the line of off
down the wicket, has to abort any plans of hitting this as he is not close to this doosra. Defended back to him
another appeal for lbw, but Dharmasena, rightly, indicates there is a big inside edge on this offbreak
pulled away to the left of Nasir Jamshed at deep square leg, who goes down slow and with one hand, and concedes three extra runs
top shot. Flighted outside off, and he crashes it between mid-off and cover
pushed to deep point for one
du Plessis gives him the charge, is nowhere near the pitch of the ball, gets a thick edge over point for four
nothing streak about this shot. Short, wide, cut away in front of square
fifth boundary off the over. Began with a misfield, and has ended with a filthy long hop down the pads. Du Plessis accepts the gift with a pull through long leg
slow delivery, just short of a length, beats the edge with the turn away
flat, into the pads, punched to long-off for one
swept away to deep square for one
turn away from him, from middle and off. Beats the outside edge
beaten on the sweep
short of a length, on off, punched to long-off for one
short of a length, angling away, punched away for a single
looks for the ramp, a length ball beats him. I reckon it has hit the outside of the top of off stump without removing the bail. Phew
driven to deep cover for one
Ingram tries to pull, the ball gets a big bit on him, but the mis-hit clears mid-on
cut away to deep point for one
full, yorker almost, dug out for a single towards cover
offbreak, turning into the pads, picked away for a single
length ball, middle and leg, turning towards off, defended back to him
slower through the air, swept away to deep square. "Ghoomegi," shouts Akmal. It was being missed

Nasir Jamshed has speared himself into the advertising hoardings. This is swept in the air, Jamshed runs to his right at the boundary, takes this over his shoulder, but realises he is going to fall over so he throws the ball back in. And what a fall he has had. Crashes into those hoardings
flat offbreak, beats his attempt to play this to leg
looks for a reverse-paddle, and is beaten
steered away to third man. They put pressure on Ajmal, who fumbles and allows them the second
length ball, punched to long-off for one
half-volley, drilled straight to mid-off
goes for another ramp, but Gul gets extra bounce out of this length ball, and beats him
gets too close to this loft, doesn't time in well, but it doesn't carry to long-on
goes for a big hit down the ground, gets a thick edge on this length ball, but it doesn't carry to third man
quick offbreak, punched to deep point for one
short, worked away to deep square for one
quick, on a length, no room, played back to him
slog-swept along the ground, gets a single to deep midwicket

Junaid has been lobbed at the long-on fence in the 45th over. That has got to be embarrassing. Incredible shot first of all. This is a shortish ball, but he says to hell with playing it square, and drives it straight and in the air. Junaid is too far in, though, and watches it go over just like a tennis player at the net
quick, offbreak, just outside off, defended
slower ball, on middle and off, cuts away, beats his attempt to run it down to third man
well played. A very late late-cut. Stays low, gets close the ball, plays late with an open face. Gets a bit of an edge, but he intended to play that shot
makes room, drives inside-out, but can't beat mid-off
full, outside off, mis-hit to cover for one
bouncer, beats his attempt at ramping it over the keeper's head
looks to pull, it gets a bit big on him, hits the higher part of the bat, but clears midwicket
Misbah knows this shot well. Faf is on his knee ramping  length ball, but has found short fine leg. Ends up in the same Misbah pose circa Wanderers 2007
yorker, middle and leg, kept out
bouncer, 136ks, Behardien is beaten on the pull
driven to short cover
another bouncer, but this Behardien gets a good chunk of it on the pull. Between deep square and deep midwicket it goes
slower ball. 118ks, full outside off, driven to mid-off for one
slower ball, 116ks, driven superbly, between mid-off and cover
full, into the pads, clipped away past short fine leg. Ajmal is a little slow there, and they take three runs
full, wide, Ingram loves it. Drives with an open face and squeezes this to the left of third man for four. He is into the 90s now
slower ball, on off, he goes across to work this to leg for one
full and wide, Behardien goes deep into the crease, goes down on a knee, turns this into a half-volley, drives it through cover for four more
inswinging yorker, dug out for a single to mid-off
driven down the ground for two
the first six of the innings. Full toss, on off, smashed over long-on. This is a big playing field, but he has cleared it
like London buses, two sixes come after each other. This is short, middle and leg, and has been pulled over deep midwicket
slower ball, full and wide, driven to deep point
yorker, swinging in, dug out. The rare dot ball
lofted down the ground, mis-hit, but it doesn't carry to long-on
can he ever? Length ball, on off, he makes room, drives inside-out, between mid-off and cover. That's a lovely shot. He is ecstatic. Reaches the hundred without hitting a six
and nearly ruins that stat of scoring 100-plus without a six. Gets under a length ball, lofts this wide of long-on, but it falls just inside the rope
full and wide now, beats Ingram, who is backing away
short, pulled away to deep midwicket
slower bouncer, Behardien is looking to guide it behind square, and is beaten
yorker, dug out towards deep midwicket, and they steal a second to take this partnership to 50 off 23 balls

inn2.comm: short of a length, pitched outside leg, beats his attempt to turn this to leg
full, shaping back in towards of off, defended to mid-off
more swing for Tsotsobe, Hafeez is hit on the thigh pad as this shapes back in
lovely shot. Too full outside off from Tsotsobe, driven with an open face, between mid-off and cover. Along the ground
shape away from just outside off, defended with an open face
defended off the front foot
full, on off, defended to cover
full, outside off, 134ks, driven to short cover
full, on off, defended into the off side
fullish outswinger, stylishly driven away, between cover and cover-point for four
he pushes at a widish ball, gets a thick edge past the slips
length ball, and he has caressed it for four. On a length, middle and leg, he pushes at this straight, between the umpire and the stumps
kicks at him from short of a length, gets big on him, he plays with soft hands, and it doesn't carry to slip
walks down the wicket and is beaten on the pull, and is hit in the rib cage
swinging in a bit, hits the bat high on the bat
length ball outside off, pushed to point
bouncer, but at a gentle pace, and chest-high, and Hafeez pulls this over square for four
full, over-pitched, driven powerfully, but straight to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, defended square on the off side
defended off the front foot. Nice crisp sound off the bat
driven square on the off side, Tsotsobe gets around from third man, but is slow to get down, and lets it slip through under his hands
quick, short of a length, and he has tucked it off the hip, fine of fine leg
flicked off the pad, wide of mid-on, takes a single
outswinger, on off, pitches on a length, Hafeez stays back and defends
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
drops and runs, and they make the single despite Behardien's quick swoop and throw from point
short of a length, just outside off, beats the cut with extra bounce
length ball, swinging back in, defended off the front foot
soft hands, pushed towards mid-off, and they take a single . Had Amla's throw hit,  Hafeez was a goner
short of a length, outside off, steered away past point
length ball, on off, angling away, and beautifully driven between cover and extra cover. All along the ground
the short cover makes no difference to Jamshed who drives this powerfully and past that short cover and through extra cover
length ball, angling in, no room, defended from the crease
length ball, into the pads, flicked to mid-on
steered away to third man for one
wide length ball, left alone
length ball, holds its line outside off, defended off the back foot
stays back to a shortish delivery, pushes it between mid-off and extra cover for one
another run-out opportunity. Driven on the up, nicely so, but straight to mid-off. Jamshed has backed up too far, but Amla misses with the throw
slower ball, he picks it, and defends it to short cover
wide length ball, slower one again, and Hafeez picks it early, rolls the wrists on the drive to keep it down, and places it through square cover
another miss. You don't expect this from South Africa, and least of all Faf du Plessis. This is a lenght ball that kicks at Hafeez, hits the leading edge high, and du Plessis drops a sitter at point
finally a catch sticks. Jamshed follows a wide length ball, almost guides it off the face to the buckets of GC Smith at first slip
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
wide length ball, moving away, left alone
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover
pushes forward at a length ball, gets an inside edge onto the pad
length ball outside off, defended to finish a wicket-maiden
short of a length, outside off, defended
cut away to third man where a fumble from Abbott allows them the second
short, no sting on it, pulled away wide of deep midwicket
slower ball, 117ks, defended off the front foot
short of a length, outside off, punched away, but can't beat cover
full, on the pads, flicked away
walks down the wicket, cuts one to point
short of a length, outside off, left alone
looks to pull one, but this one skids and nips back in to hit him in the rib cage. He has copped two there today

huge shout for catch at the wicket. Hafeez pulls, seems to be beaten, they go up for the bottom edge, but it seems to have come off the sleeve. South Africa discuss, but they decide against reviewing. Graeme Smith and Robin Peterson are the loudest opposers of this review
short of a length, pushed to cover
wide length ball, left alone. Back-to-back maidens for Rory K
angling in, but Younis plays for the turn. Hit on the pad, but it is headed down leg

turns away from Younis, who pushes forward, and de Villiers and Peterson go up for the catch spontaneously. Umpire says not out, so South Africa will review it. He has missed this by a mile, and it's the bat hitting the pad that has created the noise. We stay with not-out. It was superb from Younis: he seems to have told AB if he thought this was edged, why doesn't he back himself up and go for the review
swept away from outside off for one
short of a length, outside off, cut away to deep cover
short, on off, Younis rocks back to punch this to deep midwicket
down the wicket to drive this wide of long-off for two. Younis Khan has lost his hand towel on the pitch while running. He doesn't seem to have thrown the towel yet, though
length ball outside off, defended to cover

High drama. Kleinveldt is enjoying great luck here. Driven hard back at Kleinveldt, he has got a touch on this, and Hafeez is caught well short while backing up. There is a clear deflection as the ball passes his outstretched hand. Kleinveldt is not pleased that nobody has run after the ricochet, and the Pakistan batsmen are running. "What if he is in?" he seems to be telling his mates. It doesn't matter Rory. Hafeez is well short. Although we have had many replays, and I have no doubt the ball hit the ring finger of Kleinveldt's hand. I think Billy Bowden is not sure beyond all reasonable doubt. And we have waited for about five minutes already. Finally he has been given out. I know people will say it is a horribly unlucky way to get out, but I don't agree: you leave your crease at your own peril
defended back to him
length ball outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, dabbed away past slip for one
length ball, on the pads, worked away for one
length ball, on off, defended off the front foot
short, wide, beaten on the cut
short of a length, pushed wide of point for one
full, on off, driven to cover-point
length ball, on off, pushed with soft hands, takes a single to cover
length ball, wide, left alone
pushed wide of cover for one
cut away wide of deep cover for two
wide length ball, he drives at it, and is beaten
driven to sweeper-cover for one
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover
driven on the up, but straight to cover
length ball, outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, worked wide of mid-on for one
bouncer, he ducks under it
short and wide, extra bounce, beats the cut
cut away this time, gets a single to third man
short of a length, outside off, defended
cut away to third man
awkwardly pulled away after he had stretched forward. Gets a single to midwicket
short of a length, middle and off, worked away for one
length ball, pushed with soft hands, wide of point, gets a single
bouncer, over the stumps, he ducks under it

Shafiq falls to the bouncer. Hooks this time, but the ball gets big on him, hits him high on the bat, and he fails to keep it down. Down the throat of long leg it goes, but Abbott takes it by his shin
pushed to long-off for one
length ball outside off, defended to point
length ball, middle and leg, blocked
defended off the back foot this time
full, middle and leg, driven back to him
short of a length, outside off, defended
played to deep cover
short of a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
steered away to third man for one
angling down leg, beaten on the flick
length ball, driven with an open face, can't beat the diving du Plessis at point
fuller, straighter, defended back to him
makes room, takes this on the full, drives this wide of sweeper-cover for two
length ball, on off, defended back
length ball, on off, defended back to him
makes room, drives a full ball to long-off for one
full, middle and leg, swept away to single
fired in, cramps him up for room, pushed back to him
angling too far down the leg, deflects off the pad for four leg-byes
pushed off the front foot
tries the big drive, gets a big inside edge to leg
quick short ball, he rides the bounce, runs it down to third man for one
bouncer, middle and leg, he stays under it and inside the line
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
tossed up on off, defended off the front foot
full, on the pads, swept away down the ground for one
down the wicket to block it
full, on off, drilled to long-off for one
down the wicket to drive this inside-out, wide of sweeper-cover, for two
length, angling in, swept away to deep square
played off the back foot towards point
a length ball, the batsman gets under it and lofts towards deep midwicket
full ball outside off, driven on the front foot towards deep cover
short of a length around leg stump, pulled off the back foot behind square
Younis goes back to swat a slower bouncer awkwardly behind square, he was early on the shot and got a top edge
defended from the crease on the off side
on a length, turning away a little, defended off the front foot
driven hard, but straight to cover
makes room, Peterson bowls full and follows him, and he has slogged this to wide long-on for four. That's his style: tuk, tuk, tuk, tuk, boom, tuk, tuk, tuk, tuk,tuk
defended back to him
driven to cover
and he goes boom again, slogging one full ball to the right of deep midwicket this time
wide length ball, driven to deep cover for one

short, just outside off, and Misbah has smacked this through midwicket for four. Misbah can do this, and every knows Misbah can do this, which is what infuriates everybody because he chooses not to do it
length ball outside off, holds its line, beats the edge
short of a length, outside off, dabbed away to point
slower ball, he moves across to work this for one
top shot. Half-volley, wide, and he has rocketed it between mid-off and extra cover
length ball, on off, looks to drop and run, but the man at point is alert
wide down the leg side
short of a length, middle and off, played with soft hands, gets a single to cover
short and wide, cut away hard, but in front of square, and finds deep cover
runs this slower ball down to third man
bouncer, too high, second wide of the over
full, misfielded at cover, but they have already made their mind up to not go for it
short of a length, cut away, but can't beat point
short, wide, cut away to third man
slower ball, on the pads, they take a sharp single to square leg
backs away, digs out a yorker towards point, and they steal a single to point
full, wide, and Abbott gets a maiden ODI wicket. Yoiunis throws a whiplash drive at it, but is not close to the ball, and all he manages is an edge through to the keeper
left alone outside off
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover-point
slower ball, defended off the front foot
short, looks to cut, doesn't get all of it

tuk, tuk, tuk, and then boom. Misbah doesn't know a station between 0 and 6. The shot of the day. This is no Mickey Mouse ground, and he has sent this length ball way back into the second tier behind long-on
short and wide, and he doesn;t go after it, and gets a wide
length ball, on off, dabbed to the right of point, gets a single
short of a length, wide, steered away to third man
slower ball, 111ks, plays with soft hands, wide of du Plessis at point, and gets a single
short of a length, outside off, punched down to long-off for one
down the wicket to drive this to long-off for one
swept away superbly. This is full and wide outside off, but he reaches out and focuses more on the placement, and sweeps this between square leg and short fine leg
short of a length, pushed down to long-off for one
whipped away from in front of off, gets a single
short of a length, outside off, punched to long-on for one more
moves across to look to tuck this off the hip, but gets an inside edge into his body
short of a length, angling in, worked away for one
short, getting big on him, Malik is on hies toes to cut, but can't beat the electric fence at point that is du Plessis
slower ball, just outside off, inside-edged to leg for one

he is given, strangled down the leg side. Short of a length, angling into the rib, but a little too straight, and Misbah wants to pull. And this is a clear strangle. Misbah is in a tangle, and he gloves it to AB
punched away, but can't beat midwicket
back-cuts this late, and beats the square field on the off side
short, long hop really, and he has pulled this from outside off and over midwicket
full, on off, driven to long-off for one
looks to run this behind square, but can't behind point
short of a length, down the leg side, but Akmal fails to capitalise as he is early to close the face
short of a length, punched down, but not past RP
tossed up on off, defended off the front foot
punched away to deep cover for one
hung up high in the air, gets a thick edge from him for a single
driven to long-on for one
pushed wide of cover for a single
short of a length, angling in, defended off the back foot
left alone outside off
length ball, angling in, driven on the up, to mid-off
full, on off, looks to drive, gets a thick inside edge to midwicket

McLaren gets another wicket with a bouncer. He has used it well. Short, headed for the badge, too big for Akmal, and the top edge settles with Smith at long leg. One of his rare catches in the outfield?
gets a wide full toss first up and he drives hard at it, and gets a couple off the cue end
tossed up outside off, defended to cover
pulls a shortish delivery to long-on
short, wide, thumped away wide of sweeper-cover for two
tossed up, slow, high, Afridi resists the temptation and blocks
what a lovely shot. Down the wicket, makes room, goes inside-out, over extra cover for a six. That nearly gets a security guard at the fence
short, pulled away wristily, between long-on and deep midwicket
length ball, on the pads, flicked away for a couple into the leg side
length ball, middle and leg, driven to long-on
short of a length, middle and off, pushed with soft hands for a single
short of a length, holds its line in front of off, cramps him up
slower ball gets him. It's Malik who has fallen before Afridi. Doesn't pick the slower ball wide outside off, he goes after it, and all he manages is a thick outside edge to short third man
short of a length, on the pads, worked wide of deep square for a couple
nearly gets No. 300. Short, into the body, pulled off the front foot, lands just before the square-leg fence
that's No. 300. No one has ever hit so many ODI sixes. Short again, and this time he gets a sweeter connection and sends it sailing over deep midwicket
angling in, concedes a leg-bye
another short ball gets a wicket. This is chest-high, on off, he looks to pull, is late into it, and Kleinvelt accepts a simple return lob

Kleinveldt is on a hat-trick, and I am surprised why they aren't reviewing this one. They can't take that one home, may as well use it up. This is not plumb. Length ball, seaming in, seemingly past the inside edge, but has this hit him outside the line of off? First of all, there was a huge inside edge on this one. I really wonder why they didn't review this
and he bowls a wide down leg. was going for the yorker, I suppose
defended off the front foot
backs away to loft this low full toss over the bowler's head
drilled down to long-on. Turns down the single
slower short ball, Afridi is too early into the pull, is hit on the glove
bye bye ball. This is out of the ground. Huge. That is massive. Slower ball, and he swings it over long-on, into the parking lot. Has he damaged any cars there?
and he dabs the fifth ball of the over for a single
length ball, outside off, beats his defensive push
makes room and drills a low full toss to mid-off
it's all over. Afridi couldn't have done much about this. Short ball, pulled in front of square, and Behardien takes a diving catch at deep midwicket
